results.title: Predictors of Weight Regain and Insufficient Weight Loss According to Different Definitions After Sleeve Gastrectomy: a Retrospective Analytical Study.
results.text_hl: The multivariate analysis showed that a preoperative BMI of > 45 kg/m2 [odds ratioAdjusted (ORAdj) 1.77, 95% CI: 1.12-4.11, P = 0.038] and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ consumption [ORAdj: 0.48, 95% CI: 0.19-0.78, P = 0.001] were associated with @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@WR@@@ and @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@IWL@@@ after SG, regardless of the definition of @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@WR@@@ or @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@IWL@@@.

citations.NLM: Yarigholi F, Bahardoust M, Mosavari H, Tehrani FM, Gholizadeh H, Shahmiri SS, Rezvani H, Oshidari B, Garakani K, Eghbali F. Predictors of Weight Regain and Insufficient Weight Loss According to Different Definitions After Sleeve Gastrectomy: a Retrospective Analytical Study. Obes Surg. 2022 Dec;32(12):4040-4046. PMID: 36260221
citations.BibTeX: @article{36260221, title={Predictors of Weight Regain and Insufficient Weight Loss According to Different Definitions After Sleeve Gastrectomy: a Retrospective Analytical Study.}, author={Yarigholi F and Bahardoust M and Mosavari H and Tehrani FM and Gholizadeh H and Shahmiri SS and Rezvani H and Oshidari B and Garakani K and Eghbali F}, journal={Obes Surg}, volume={32}, number={12}, pages={4040-4046}}

results.title: High Prevalence of Positive Genetic Obesity Variants in Postoperative Bariatric Surgery Patients with Weight Regain Presenting for Medical Obesity Intervention.
results.text_hl: All received @CHEMICAL_Azoxymethane @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001397 @@@AOM@@@ and required at least 3 @CHEMICAL_Azoxymethane @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001397 @@@AOMs@@@ for weight @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@regain@@@. Semaglutide (N = 21), @CHEMICAL_Topiramate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077236 @@@topiramate@@@ (N = 14), and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (N = 12) were most prescribed.

citations.NLM: Samuels JM, Paddu NU, Rekulapeli A, Madhar A, Srivastava G. High Prevalence of Positive Genetic Obesity Variants in Postoperative Bariatric Surgery Patients with Weight Regain Presenting for Medical Obesity Intervention. Obes Surg. 2023 Nov 23;():. PMID: 37996769

results.title: Genetic Predictors of Weight Loss and Weight Regain After Intensive Lifestyle Modification, Metformin Treatment, or Standard Care in the Diabetes Prevention Program
results.text_hl: We tested genetic associations with @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@weight regain@@@ in the @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@Diabetes@@@ Prevention Program, a randomized controlled trial of @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@-inducing interventions (lifestyle and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@) versus placebo.

citations.NLM: Delahanty LM, Pan Q, Jablonski KA, Watson KE, McCaffery JM, Shuldiner A, Kahn SE, Knowler WC, Florez JC, Franks PW, Diabetes Prevention Program Research Group. Genetic Predictors of Weight Loss and Weight Regain After Intensive Lifestyle Modification, Metformin Treatment, or Standard Care in the Diabetes Prevention Program Diabetes Care. 2012 Feb;35(2):363-6. PMID: 22179955

results.title: Dipeptidyl Peptidase-4 Inhibitor Sitagliptin Prevented Weight Regain in Obese Women with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome Previously Treated with Liraglutide: A Pilot Randomized Study.
results.text_hl: We evaluated whether @GENE_DPP4 @GENE_1803 @@@dipeptidyl peptidase-4@@@ (@GENE_DPP4 @GENE_1803 @@@DPP-4@@@) inhibitor @CHEMICAL_Sitagliptin_Phosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068900 @@@sitagliptin@@@ in adjunct to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ prevents body @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@weight regain@@@ more effectively than @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ alone in @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@obese polycystic ovary syndrome@@@ (@DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@) previously treated with liraglutide.

citations.NLM: Ferjan S, Janez A, Jensterle M. Dipeptidyl Peptidase-4 Inhibitor Sitagliptin Prevented Weight Regain in Obese Women with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome Previously Treated with Liraglutide: A Pilot Randomized Study. Metab Syndr Relat Disord. 2017 Dec;15(10):515-520. PMID: 29064743

results.title: Weight Loss Medications in Young Adults after Bariatric Surgery for Weight Regain or Inadequate Weight Loss: A Multi-Center Study
results.text_hl: Unfortunately, co-morbidities often return with @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@weight regain@@@.
